alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 8:31PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern St. John The Baptist, northeastern Orleans, St. Tammany, southeastern Tangipahoa Parishes in southeastern Louisiana and southern Hancock Counties through 930 PM CDT... At 830 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Folsom to 8 miles north of Lacombe to near Pearl River to Kiln. Movement was southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Slidell, Covington, Waveland, Diamondhead, East New Orleans, Pearl River, Abita Springs, Madisonville, Lake Catherine, Kiln, Pearlington, Lacombe, Shoreline Park, Stennis Space Center, Slidell Airport and Lakefront Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 244 and 254, and between mile markers 261 and 273. Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 16. Interstate 12 between mile markers 51 and 84. Interstate 55 in Louisiana near mile marker 17. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 9. Interstate 510 between mile markers 1 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
